Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you prefer the night life.”
Reviews.Author: Gary R
Reviews.Content: The noise was intolerable at times, especially weekends. I can handle the noise from the street but the noise from the club downstairs and from its patrons was more than I could take. We left early and stayed at another hotel anticipating a noisy Friday night crowd. If you are there for the night life, then this is the ticket for you. Centrally located, it's and easy stumble back to you room from anywhere, especially from the club downstairs. We had two adjoining rooms, well furnished, very clean. The toilets, however, didn't flush well. You had to hold the handle down until it fully flushed. The lights in the ceiling fan didn't work so we had to get them fixed: one light bulb and one starter switch. Two washers and two dryers if you decide to do laundry. The bus stop is right out in front. There's a Subway just out front as well. The staff were super!!! I can't say enough on how friendly and helpful they were. If you have kids and aren't into the night life, then don't stay here. It doesn't quiet down until 4 AM.

Reviews.Title: “This Ain't The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BDragoncop
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club. The cons to this property are as follows: The rooms are small. The 3 of us just barely fit and I would not try to fit a fourth. The Murphy bed is not what the average person is used to. Personally I sleep on a king sized pillow top foam mattress at home. The furnishings are dated. Think Starsky and Hutch or Hawaii Five-O. No pool. No activities to speak of. The neighborhood is a little sketchy. That being said the rooms are OK for two people and they are clean. If you request an egg crate foam mattress topper the bed is quite tolerable. This is not a luxury resort where you would loll around and soak up the ambiance. As far as the neighborhood goes one must remember that Waikīkī is the tourist district of Honolulu, located between the Ala Wai Canal and the Pacific Ocean next to Diamond Head. Numerous hotels, shops, and nightlife opportunities are located along Kalakaua and Kuhio Avenues. It is a popular location for visitors and locals alike and attracts millions of visitors every year. The attraction here is Oahu and Waikiki Beach. Like any large city (2011 census estimate over 936,000) you find the homeless, prostitution and crime. You also find this in Small Town USA. Due vigilance is required. Being central to all of the activities is the biggest assest this property has. The second biggest is the staff who embody the true Aloha spirit and bend over backwards to accommodate you. They have beach chairs, umbrellas, coolers and coolers available to rent which was very handy. I would not recommend this property to everyone. For the young party crowd it works extremely well. Even a couple if you truly are there to see Oahu and only sleep in the room. Overall I would give it a 2 ½ star rating and that high because of the location and the staff. I’ve stayed in much worse RCI properties in Cape Cod and AAA recommended hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Just stayed there”
Reviews.Author: anniebelle1946
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a week there, We read the reviews and was prepared for the worst, The noise on the street was the worst. We were on 3rd floor Granted the furnishing was dated, but it was clean. the lighting in Bath could have been better. My friend had a hard time in shower, I did not. You could not asked for a Better staff anywhere. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION, it was the best. I really did not see the strip club.We did not plan to stay in the room all that much anyway, The air did cut on and off at night. It is not the Hyatt by no means. RCI in Gulf Shores Ala. Was not much better. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah112903
Reviews.Content: We booked this through RCI and I am really surprised that this is even listed by them. Really really surprised. Lots of other reviewers mentioned the questionable night life and noise from the bar. I can not comment to that as I refused to stay here. The staff was very friendly and greeted us with orchid leis and that was the last good experience I had there. I was worried about what the rooms would be like from the appearance of the tiny "lobby." I actually cried when we entered our room. It was tiny which I could live with but the filth in that room was not tolerable!!! We took our luggage back to our car and I called VI (our timeshare company). They refunded our points and booked us in a much nicer timeshare (Fairway Villa) with a rooftop pool and sweeping views of Honolulu, Waikiki, and Diamond Head free of charge. We have stayed there many times since. If our room had not been switched it would have ruined our vacation and we would have had to find somewhere else to stay because there is no way I would ever sleep in such a filthy place. I usually don't write reviews, especially bad ones but I want to save anyone from going here expecting a budget but clean motel type experience and get a filthy ghetto dive instead. Spend the money or points to stay somewhere else! This place needs to be torn down!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Amyandbrett
Reviews.Content: I knew we had gotten a good rate on this accommodation however I would not stay or recommend to anyone to stay there again. It is desperate for renovations! Though the staff was kind, and other guests were friendly it didn't make up for the gross accommodations or the strip club directly below that will keep you us ALL night long! Our bed was duct taped together and came out of the wall. The only reason we stayed for the duration of our booking was only that it was prepaid. I won't be back! Hawaii was amazing and we found lots of nice places that kept us away from our hotel from morning till night!

Reviews.Title: “Booking through AGODA .com”
Reviews.Author: Keith H
Reviews.Content: Beware of this company!!! we booked 3 rooms at the Kuhio Banyan in Waikiki. When we arrived Agoda had only requested the Hotel book 1 room. We were left during Pro Bowl week to find 2 more rooms for a week!! We have been 2 weeks trying to get our money back for the 2 rooms we paid for and didn't get. Kuhio Banyan --old and located in crime area of Kuhio avenue. Would not recommend this Hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Aboyle3
Reviews.Content: The reviews I read had me worried for nothing. A freind is an owner and got my husband and I a great deal on one of the rooms. We are in our 40s & would not recommmend this place for kids due to no pool and location at night. We paid no extra fees like the other review mentioned, not sure if they had another type of rental agreement. This motel/hotel is in the heart of Waikiki close to everything you want to do. I never saw a cockroach & we evaluated for bed bugs and found none. Yes a night club is downstairs, but never heard a thing and we were directly above it. Hookers & homeless...yep saw them on Kuhio Ave. & on the beachwalk by the higher priced hotels. The place was dated but clean and everything worked in the room. No Shampoo/cond. but soap and towels provided daily. Hotel Security was always walking at night and you needed a seperate key for the outside door and your room. Yes it was the old style keys, but it is an old hotel. Beach towels available at the front desk but you had to keep them for the week. Washer & dryer available but always in use. Boogie Boards free to use at the front desk. Snorkel rental around the corner. Every place you want to eat right near your room. We saved a ton of money staying here and basically only slept in our room. We went to the North Shore and spend $300 on a room at Turtle Bay Resort which was really nice with an oceanview.....However, we felt like we needed to hang out in our room or at least at the hotel to get our moneys worth. If you plan to hangout in your room/resort and not explore Oahu then spend the increase money. Otherwise stay at the Kuhio Banyan Club & save your money for activities, food and rental cars. Check out the Tiki Bar at Aston Hotel we really liked it! Aloha

Reviews.Title: “Yikes, this is not a place you want to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Justin C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kuhio Banyan in mid January 2012. This place is not nice and we did find cockroaches in the room but no bed bugs as other reviews have mentioned....and we searched thoroughly. The carpet was old and very dirty as were the furnishings. The paint near light switches and doors was discolored from dirt and grime. Housekeeping only comes on Tuesday and they count and re-count every single towel and washcloth with stern warnings that you will pay dearly if one disappears. The nightclub/strip club on the ground floor is so loud some nights that the ineffective air conditioner is not even loud enough to drown out the noise. We did not even stay for the entire time we had the place reserved. We were out of there before sunrise and did not return until after dark. Waikiki beach was within about 4 blocks so it was easy to get to although crowded as usual. Not much good to say about the Kuhio Banyan. Several other guests that are affiliated with RCI told us that this place was hands down the worst RCI property they have been to....by a long shot. Other properties are within about 15 feet of his building and contain a multitude of interesting folks, long term renters I think. Each morning we were greeted by 10 or 20 minutes of coughing and hacking from one of the nearby chain smokers who had to clear a substantial amount of gunk from his lungs. The bus route is directly in front of the building and busy 24 hours a day making for lots of noise. Parking is awful if you rent a car and very expensive. The resort will nickel and dime you nearly to death at check in with additional fees and charges. We will not return to this place ever again and will discourage everyone we know from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a young couple.”
Reviews.Author: Smithma2
Reviews.Content: As a young couple staying in Waikiki for a week, this place worked pretty well. It is a small space, but we didn't need much. Heads up, the refrigerator is small (like one you'd find in a standard hotel) so don't expect to store much in it. It contains only one window AC unit, but since it was a studio space, it worked just fine to cool the place down. If you plan to spend your vacation in your room, then you won't enjoy your time here. We only used our room to sleep and shower, otherwise we were out enjoying the sites, and therefore didn't mind the small space. We did enjoy the close proximity of restaurants, shopping, beaches, things to do, and bus routes to our room. The gentleman on site who assisted us in planning our day trips was very helpful and we greatly appreciated his expertise. We did not have a vehicle with us and we're glad we didn't. Parking availability is low since it is downtown Honolulu. That's why we enjoyed being able to walk everywhere or jumping on the bus that stops right out front! Overall, this space isn't high class by any means, but it worked great for us who hardly spent any time there.

Reviews.Title: “Definetley not the best but would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: firefighter57
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a 5 star timeshare then don't waste your time here. I am a little surprised that RCI even lists this property. First let me tell you the bad, but please keep reading till the end. This property is old and is in desperate need of an update. I mean desperate!! The carpet needs replacing and the rooms need to be gutted and redone. at one end is a nightclub, it is close to a busy street and yes at night there are "ladies of the evening trying to make some money out on the street. These rooms should only be listed as max 2 not 4.There are no views of anything pretty. The tv is small, there is no oven and it has a mini-fridge. When you go out the front door you are looking at the back of an unattractive apt bldg. There are no internet connection in the rooms. Now let me tell you about the good, LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!! You are across the street from the international market, There is a Chilis, drugstore, gracery store, Starbucks, Dennys, Subway, ATM,ABC store and more restraunts all within two blocks. Cut through the market and you can be on Kalakaua street in about 3-5 min and be at Waikiki within 5-10 min. I have never had any trouble with the staff. They have all been very nice and helpful when we have stayed there. Our room this month was very clean(yes it was very dated but it was clean). The murphy bed was comfortable, We both slept well The sheets were fresh and we didn't find any bed bugs. the little window unit kept it cool enough. My wife didn't like her pillow, we called the front desk and within 5 min they brought a new one up. They have a security guard at night and you need a key to get in the bldg at all times. I have never felt unsafe here. Hint; when making a reservation ALWAYS request 3rd or 4th floor and as far away from the nightclub as possible. We did and had no problem, we were on the third floor. I have never had any problem with outside noise. The Banyan will never be my first choice when going to Honolulu but i would stay there again. We are never in our room that much. No doubt one day it wii probably be torn down and replaced with a newer more modern bldg.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie T
Reviews.Content: I was totally shocked that a hotel such as this would be available through RCI as we have stayed at beautiful properties in the past! Upon inital check of the bed linen found a live bedbug scurring for cover!!! The office staff offered another room where we also found signs of bed bugs and no shower curtain. The other reviews of this property are not exagerating at all! We had to find another hotel to stay at immediatly upon arrival! This experience could have easily ruined our trip right from the start!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Diane U
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple were scheduled to stay for a week. At the last minute the other couple had to cancel. I was so glad they did because when I saw the place I was absolutely horrified and would have been very embarrassed for them to see this place. They were going to join us as our guest. I felt very uncomfortable staying there and if it wasn't for my husband who was able to tolerate the place, I would have packed up and left the next day. The shower was horrible and I felt very unclean even after having taken a shower. I could hardly stand to sleep in the bed and did not sleep well during the entire time. Also, there was a drunk hanging around outside and some lady on the phone talking very loudly at 2:00 am. The first morning that I got up to go for my run, there were police and a fire truck parked outside as someone from the bar got into a fight and had to go to the hospital. I don't want to go into what the rest of the week was like. Suffice it to say that every morning there was a new adventure awaiting me when I got up to go for my run. I have stayed in some pretty bad places and for the most part, am able to stand it. This place, however, was the worst that I've ever stayed in and will never return if this was the last place in Oahu. It's worth it to pay the extra money for the peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not the fanciest place to stay, but it was clean”
Reviews.Author: summer_rose8
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews here and on other sites, I was very hesitant about staying here. I had decided to go ahead and give the place a try. When my party and I, 3 total, first checked in, we were warmly greeted. They gave us two sets of keys, a tv remote, and a card key for the room safe. I was a little surprised to see each set of keys had two keys attached to the ring. I was told one was for the room, and the other was for the main door after it was locked at night. That's right; there is no 24/7 service here. Staff is there from 7am to 10pm each day. If you're out past 10pm, you need a key to get back into the place. Don't have it? You're probably going to have to call someone from staff to drive all the way out to this place and let you back in, which can be up to a 2 hour wait and a $45 charge. I made sure to have my key on my person at all times so I wouldn't end up in this predicament. The single elevator here is the smallest I've ever seen. It didn't smell when I got on it, but the carpet certainly looked old. Me and my group were squeezed tightly into the small space of the elevator as we made our way up to our room, which was on the top-most floor. Now the balcony leading to the room, there was a neighboring building right in front of us which looked like a residential building. I couldn't tell exactly if this really was Section 8 housing as another reviewer brought up. The entire time I was here, I didn't really see any residents out. However, there were two nights I heard a young woman arguing on a phone about some troubled relationship of hers. It sounded like it was coming straight from this residential building. This was around 4am in the morning. But this is nothing. There are a couple of bars nearby the Banyan, blaring music early in the night with people loudly talking and laughing up a storm. The first few nights I stayed here, I had trouble sleeping, but got quickly adjusted to it and it didn't bother me. Moving on to the room, when I first entered it, it was clean. The furniture and carpet seriously are old and worn, though. They're simply begging to be replaced. The bathroom was nice save for the grungy shower tiles. They looked as though they haven't been cleaned in a decade. I didn't dare step barefoot onto them but rather wore an old pair of sandals while showering. I did stumble upon a baby cockroach one evening in the bathroom. It scared the life out of me before shooting into a crack in the wall. Luckily, I had some boric acid on hand. I sprinkled a little around the cracks and didn't see another cockroach (I also made sure to keep the entire unit tidy as possibile). The entire place is a small step up from a Motel 6, but only by a hair. It was still comfy, so I tried not to make a fuss much. I didn't stay here too much, only as a place to sleep in mostly. The two things I liked about this place were the staff and most importantly, the location. The staff were very helpful in any questions I had, including different destinations and the different routes aboard the Bus. For location, many shops are so close by, as well as numerous restaurants. The beach is a short walk away, too. Although the Kuhio Banyan wasn't too far from many local attractions and the unit had a few extras such as a stove-top burner (pretty basic; see photos to get an idea what they look like), I'd be hesitant to recommend this place to others. To be honest, I'm drawn down the line as to whether I'd tell people to look elsewhere or to give this place a shot. The few perks of this place had won me over somewhat, but then again, the cons, such as that roach, the loud night noise, and let me not forget to mention that one bum constantly wandering in front of the Banyan, have me disliking this place. What I will recommend to travelers out there is to definitely do your homework and look for a good deal on a nice hotel. If by the chance you're not able to come across anything you like, only then would I recommend the Kuhio Banyan as a fair location to try.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: allan11209
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually a old motel 6. It has a horrible evening life because of the street walkers and the loitering party cloud. The unit was damp and old with the most outdated decor. This is not a quality vacation experiance. I would have done better sleeping at the beach and using the room for a closet. Don't try to justify this hotel as just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to everything . . . not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ancsteve
Reviews.Content: In spite of the bad reviews, we went ahead and stayed as an RCI exchange. We weren't sure what to expect so were pleasently surprised when we arrived to a welcoming check-in, a clean room and an outstanding location. Folks who are upset at their less than palatial surroundings should get a clue by the amount of points required to stay there. The floors were clean, the counters were clean, the refrigerator worked, the bathroom was clean. It isn't the Ritz. In fact, our home resort is beachfront on another island. But, if one is intent on staying in Waikiki, they could do a lot worse (we have in the past). The only drawback we could find was the necessity of keeping the air conditioner on 24/7, as there is no ventilation. Again, one is downtown so open windows aren't quite as nice as they are on a beach. The Kuhio Banyan is a couple of notches above Motel 6, without the pool. And, even most of the hotels in Waikiki depend on A/C, and dicourage open lanai doors. That said, TheBus is absolutely fantastic. $2.50 per adult one way anywhere a tourist would like to go and all of the routes from Waikiki stop directly in front. The 2 Bus travels to many of the most desireable locations and runs every 10-15 minutes (no way to really keep a schedule in that traffic). With public transportation like this, there is no need for a rental car unless you just have to have one - and parking is horrible. Spend $5 at the ABC store and get TheBus Map and Guide Book. To sum up, as the realtors say, location, location, location. Lots of great shows, restaurants and shops within easy walking distance, from a clean location. (Never saw any hookers and I think the nightclub is either defunct or tamed.)

Reviews.Title: “The Kuhio Banyan Club, A.K.A. “The DUMP””
Reviews.Author: 23lakers
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we then found out we had to put a security deposit of $250, plus daily rental and tax fees ($11.69/day) on top of it, for each studio. Finally we grabbed our keys (yes, they still use door keys), remote for the TV, and safe key.We went to our rooms and traveled up to the third floor, in a smelly sickening elevator. The elevator had old carpet that smelled like urine, mixed with mold & mildew. The rooms were trashed; sand everywhere, old smelly room, with filthy furniture. RCI states these studios would accommodate up to 4 people, which is unrealistic because you couldn’t pull the other beds out after dropping the bed from the cabinet. One night we came back to the hotel and my friend counted 12 prostitutes standing in a 10 x 12 foot section across the street. The whole stay was UNACCEPTABLE and I hold RCI responsible for NOT providing any QUALITY CONTROL on their Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be in the RCI exchange”
Reviews.Author: gsd2
Reviews.Content: This place is in a sad state of disrepair. Our room was on the 3rd floor, better to take the stairs as the elevator is tiny and completely covered in old carpet. At the back of the condo you look down on trash filled patios, the front window looks out onto the roof of a Subway. In the morning we saw homeless going through the trash. The furniture is beat up, and worn. The cleanliness is questionable, we never took of our socks. The murphy bed was so bad, we slept on the 2 sofas, only to be woken at 3:30am by a bar fight from the adjoining night club. The rooms still use keys, and only have a safety chain, no dead bolt. There is no night staff after 10pm. We did not feel safe in this area at all. RCI's computer was down, so we had to stay one night, thankfully the next morning we spoke to a very understanding supervisor, who could only move us to another island , so instead returned our week and exchange fee. We ended up having to pay for a hotel for the duration of our stay, not something we had budgeted for. It's a crime that RCI does not require it's properties to meet some kind of standard.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches larvae were crowling out the sink.”
Reviews.Author: COPII
Reviews.Content: I went there just for one night, although the recent reviews were negative. I thought it was going to be fine for one night. The staff is very nice and really helps you with good advices. They provide for free towels and umbrellas for the beach, which adds value. The Kuhio Banyan had old wall papers, stairs in not so good state, however it seemed it was going to be ok considering the services it provide. The kitchen corner of the room had virtually everything you could think of, and the bathroom was big. The place is not new, but it appeared clean. In the night, however, I came back to the room and about 20 baby roaches were hanging out in the sink of the kitchen corner. I killed all, but later, more came out from the sink and exploring the whole kitchen. I killed ost of them before my girlfriend saw them. I just told her that we are not alone. I sealed the sink and went to bed with lights on, terrified. During the night I had to switch off the air conditioning and the fridge because they were too loud. It's not true there's a strip bar next to it, it's a normal club, but it's true that you can here the music for the club until late in the night. I woke up at 6 next morning and left as soon as possible, glad I had to stay there only for one night. I'm sorry for the staff, but I raccomand not to go there.

Reviews.Title: “WORLD MARK SHOULD NOT BE AFFLIATED WITH THIS HOTEL "IT EMBARRASING"”
Reviews.Author: Leliani1950
Reviews.Content: OMG How could world mark have any association with the kuhio banyan? It looks like a homeless shelter, not I think the homeless shelter are probably a little more upscale. Someone from world amrk needs to go and take a look at this hotel. the way they publize it and the picture they show are not what it really is like. The location is in a spot where at 10:30 or before the street is full of "very different people" if you know what I mean. Take your money if you have to pay and get a room in a different location. There are lots of good deals in the area. Save your points if you are using world mark points and use them somewhere else. This hotel is disgusting and for World Mark and RCI using this location does not do anything good for the creditbility.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SiriusSam
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we took an RCI Cruise and Stay package. We arrived at this hotel only to meet a couple who had been given a 'chemical bomb' to get rid of the cockroaches in their room! The housekeeping staff had left so they were expected to leave while the the room was fumigated and then come back and clean it up. We found toe-nail clippings on the floor of our room along with burn marks on the carpet. The bed was a Murphy-bed with a horrible thin mattress. The room was grungy, dirty and badly worn out. We moved out and went to another hotel. We found the Kuhio Banyon to be horrible and RCI shouldn't have it in their inventory. Yes, it is close to the beach, but also beside a noisy nightclub. We did not get our money back, RCI gave us a week to use in the future but still a big rip-off. We were told by one of the local travel people that the Moms break down in tears when they realize this is where the family is booked for their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Parking ...watch out”
Reviews.Author: localtraveler64
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Waikiki Banyon Hotel in a Time Share unit,. The unit itself was great. My issue is the parking. Whatever you do make sure you get a parking pass from the timeshare office. If you pay for parking inadvertantly they will not give you a refund. I had payed for weekly parking and went back after 10 minutes when I realized the parking was included and they refused to give a refund. the property general manger was very unprofessional. Timeshare office managers grumpy. Room was nice and clean. Great location, 3 min walk to beach and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Tear It Down!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoanCooper2
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have ever stayed in, in my life. I traded Christmas week in a luxury time share in San Francisco for the Roach motel. No where to park the car to even unload luggage. No staff after 9:00 p.m. The stereo only played tapes. Really!! Tapes?? Does anyone own a tape.?? The beds were like sleeping on a wooden slab with a grass mat. The place smelled badly. It was dirty. The carpeting must have been the original piece of carpeting invented and "still in place." No shampoo and conditioner. To get to your room you had to go by an apartment building that had balconies with people sleeping on them. There is a strip club right outside the door with scantily clad girls trying to lure people in. Not a family friendly location. If you want an extra towel, it is $2.50. Don'tgo there if you expect any kind of amenities. If RCI sticks you there demand to be moved. We arrived on Sat. afternoon and they moved us on Mon. morning to a very nice place. RCI needs to dump this place. It is not fair to RCI members, We pay a lot of money for these timeshares and they should be more discerning about there accommodatins or represent them as they really are.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome and close to the EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: ngiovanni
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a luxury hotel then this is not the place for you. If your looking for some place to eat sleep and get back out and enjoy the island then this is the place for you. We visited Hawaii because we attended a wedding. I stayed here with my hubby and 2 year old son. While everyone else was stuck on some far part of the island. We were in the middle of everything. Everything was in walking distance from us. ATM, Any restaurant you can think of, the market, the malls and by the way the beach is just a hop skip and a jump. (1 block away) OMG.. If your looking for an upscale luxurious hotel then yea you will be disappointed. But why go to Hawaii, Waikiki to be in a luxury hotel and pay luxurious money when there is sooo much to see and do outside. Also I would suggest to plan your trips ahead of time. Apply for the go card so you can get a taste of every aspect of Hawaii if your into advertures definetly take a trip to the big islands. The tour guides/trips were very organized. Overall we had a phenominal time. I would def do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: eknliz
Reviews.Content: Frankly I don't know why all the bad reviews, Kuhio Banyan is a very simple place. It is great for a jumping off place for all your site seeing. What more do you need. Great location, Very nice, helpful staff! Thanks Joanie, Jiselle and Andrew! Yes the place could use updating, but it was clean and had everything we needed, my only complaint is that the murphy bed was to hard for my tastes, but hey I was in Hawaii, and I had a great time. There are places to eat any where you walk, really loved the Seaside Restaurant, corner of Seaside and Kuhio, good food, nice staff, and Puka Dog at the entance to the International Market, Great dogs and the Best lemonade I've ever had. I will definitely go back if I ever get the chance, Thanks Kuhio Banyan!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, needs updating badly”
Reviews.Author: nikkimet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club in Nov 2009 for 1 week on an RCI exchange. It was a wonderful location in the heart of Waikiki Beach, and yes it was hard to find as it does not really look like a hotel the way the entrance is. Out front is a court yard area, a night club, nail Salon and a Subway, on the corner of the block is an amazing Philly Cheesesteak Place with good food for decent prices. The staff were helpful and very friendly and the rental of the beach chairs, boogie boards etc was awesome to have. The room was disappointing, I "think" it was clean but really can't be sure as everything was so old and worn it didn't "feel" clean. We used the fridge but I would not have wanted to cook anything there, and I wore my flip flops to shower.... The bed had the topper on it and was comfortable. We didn't spend a lot of time here so it wasn't a big deal but I don't know that I would stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget, and just need a place to sleep is ok”
Reviews.Author: lec77
Reviews.Content: The equivalent of a roach motel at its best, but sometimes budget leaves no choice..........why pay $150 + + for other hotels when you are in Waikiki, out of your room most of the day sightseeing and on the beach??? Location of this hotel can't be beat for the price, though if you really think of all the fees you pay for maintenance fee on your own resorts, this is not a cheap stay. It is upsetting.......to say the least We looked at the reviews, but nothing compared to the shock when we walked in. I was in the military and backed packed quite a bit, but my daughter, you could see the disappointment in her eyes. What saved me the next day was the location. You are right on Waikiki, and I had the GO Oahu card, had arranged all the tours, therefore we only came in to sleep. Not the most comfortable sleep, a Murphy bed, with a TV that you can't watch once you open the bed, but we were so tired from our day out that it really did not matter. I only recommend this "resort" Ha ha ha......if you are on a budget. Staying here allowed us to do other things. Oahu is expensive, if you are traveling with kids, bring cereal to get you started on your day. A box of cheerios or Honey clusters is $7.00 milk $9.00 gallon........ peanut butter 3.00 for an 8oz as well as jelly same price. International Market across the street, thursdays is farmers market, lots of reasonable priced fruit, after paying 3.80 for two apples, 99cents for a banana. The staff was friendly, that and the location made up for the terrible accommodations. They should at least splurge on replacing the mattress and replacing the covers on the small couches. The bathrooms also need a lot of help. I had second thoughts about sitting on the couch. Ok for two people, but 4 would be impossible....... The 19 takes you from and to the airport, no need to pay for a shuttle unless you have lots of luggage. Roberts Hawaii dominates the sightseeing market and they are the most reasonable for airport shuttle, I think 15 or 16 bucks round trip. 19 bus $2.25 stops right in-front of the "resort" ha ha ha. No need to rent a car. The Bus and the trolly's take you everywhere. I would recommend this only if you are on a budget. Hawaii is over rated...... Oh! you have to pay, an additonal $70 something for the use of beach towels, chairs, and hotel tax. You have to "sign out the blow dryer, iron, ironing board. No shampoo, and cheap soap so take your own. Sun screen is not expensive is the same price and you don't take the chance of the airport personnel keeping your sun screen...... Subway in the complex, as well as a Japanese take our fast food, pretty good and reasonable. Also they have a restaurant similar to Benihana's that was good and reasonable. I think the name was Takana or Tanaka??? sp

Reviews.Title: “Traveled back to 70s”
Reviews.Author: dockc
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived the door was locked because our flight was late. We had to stand on the curb for 3 hours until someone came to open the office. While waiting there was a homeless person on the steps of the hotel throwing up. We then entered the most claustraphobic (sp?) elevator in the world. You have to make two trips to get two people and suitcases upstairs(slim people). We unlocked our room door (lock looks like a bathroom lock) and walked back into the late 70s early 80s. The room was clean but the stained carpets and chairs did not feel clean. The bathroom tiles were mildewed. Needless to say, we left to stay at the Marriott on the beach. This hotel is two blocks from the beach. The hotel is okay if you are drunk frat boys looking for a place to "crash" for spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Could've used this advice before - room too small for 4!”
Reviews.Author: SKA_Alaska
Reviews.Content: Vintage 70's or early 80's decor...ok for a middle aged couples. Right on the main Waikiki strip 2 blocks from the beach and shopping. Beds were acceptable but not great. Clean and useful kitchen and bathroom. Free safe in the room. Good security. Very good service. We requested and got a wireless modem for a cheap price for the entire week. Very friendly staff. They extended our stay until evening of our flight without any charge. We would stay again...without the teenagers with us.

Reviews.Title: “Kuhio Banyan Club”
Reviews.Author: cindyguk
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Kuhio Banyan Club 5-12 Sept. I needed to use an RCI week and was heading to Waikiki anyway and that was all that was available for that particular week which I needed. Thanks to other reviews on trip advisor, I knew to ask for the egg crate foam for the murphy bed mattress which was too hard for me as I realized the first night. I called the front desk the first morning I was there and the foam was added to my bed and remade before I got back from the activities briefing --very responsive. The rooms are small --OK for two people --but would be crowded for more even though the couch and loveseat turn into twin beds. The closet is in the bathroom. The rooms were clean and the location is great with the bus stops just outside. We rented a car only one day because we didn't want to deal with the parking issue and we'd been there before and didn't need to use the bus too much. (THE BUS only takes what luggage you could carry on to a plane.) The backpack beach chairs were nice and other equipment is available but each room is required to pay the same fee upon check out (I think it was about $70) which covered use of equipment whether you use it or not. If this were the only RCI condo available, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Kuhio Banyan Club
HotelInfo.Address: 2310 Kuhio Ave, Honolulu, Oahu, HI 96815-5050
